data.name: settingsMsg
data.value: Settings have been changed. Click Apply / Undo to continue.

data.name: hungServerNotes
data.value: If the number of threads specified by Hung Thread Count execute for longer than the time specified by Busy Thread Time, the server is considered to be unresponsive.

data.name: cfcNotes
data.value: (Specify the CFC to process this alert)

data.name: cfcNotes1
data.value: Note: Alert CFCs must have a function named onAlert() which takes no arguments and returns no values.

data.name: slowServerNotes
data.value: If the average response time of the server exceeds the specified threshold, this alert is triggered

data.name: excludeMsg
data.value: Specify absolute paths that you do not want the server monitor to include in monitoring activity.

data.name: includeMsg
data.value: Specify absolute paths that you want the server monitor to include in monitoring activity.

data.name: rules
data.value:
If you do not specify any paths in Excluded Paths and Included Paths, the Server Monitor collects information about everything on the ColdFusion Server.
If you specify a path in both Exclude Paths and Include Paths, the path is excluded.
If a path to the ColdFusion Administrator appears in the Include Paths, but the Monitor the ColdFusion Administrator option is not enabled, the path is excluded.

data.name: profilingRules
data.value:
Rules for Include / Exclude paths:
  1. All paths are absolute.
  2. If you do not include / exclude anything, everything is included.
  3. If you put a path in both include and exclude, the path is excluded.
  4. If you included a path but want to exclude some subpaths from this path, for example, you want to include "C:\\Cfusion8\\wwwroot\\MyProjects\\" but exclude "C:\\Cfusion8\\wwwroot\\MyProjects\\Project1\\", you should put the former in Include Paths and the latter in Exclude Paths.
  5. If you include any ColdFusion Administrator page in Include Path and the Check CF Admin checkbox is not selected, the page is not monitored.

data.name: VarbyMem
data.value: Top 10 Variables That Use The Most Memory

data.name: avgThrottleSize1
data.value: Average posted content length from this template.

data.name: avgThrottleSize2
data.value: (The average is over the number of times the post to the template exceeded the throttle threshold.)

data.name: maxThrottleSize
data.value: Maximum posted content length in a single request to this template.

data.name: minThrottleSize
data.value: Minimum posted content length in a single request to this template.

data.name: abortRequestConfirmMsg
data.value: Are you sure you want to abort this request?

data.name: abortThreadConfirmMsg
data.value: Are you sure you want to abort this thread?

data.name: descInUseConn
data.value: Number of connections currently checked out from the pool

data.name: descTotalConn
data.value: Total connections in pool (includes both availiable and connections in use)

data.name: descMaxConn
data.value: Maximum possible connections configured for this Data Source

data.name: descAvgTotalConn
data.value: Average Total Connections in pool over time

data.name: descAvgInUseConn
data.value: Average number of connections checked out from the pool over time

data.name: LogoutError
data.value: Error occurred. Click OK to refresh Server Monitor.

data.name: activeRequest0
data.value:
Lists all active requests to the server.
If the request is for a CFC, the requested CFC function name also appears.

data.name: activeRequest1
data.value: View details of an active request on this page. The CFML stack trace provides a pointer to the state of the request's execution.

data.name: activeRequest2
data.value: View graphs detailing the running and queued request count (only for standalone deployments), server's average response time across all requests and the number of requests that the server is handling per second. Requests per second and average response time are computed over a 60 second window.

data.name: slowRequest0
data.value:
Lists the slowest requests to the server.
If the request is for a CFC, the requested CFC function name also appears.

data.name: slowRequest1
data.value:
View statistics for a selected slow request. If profiling is turned on, the top 10 slowest tags and functions are also displayed, along with
a CFML stack trace to the location of the tag or function invocation.

data.name: activeSession0
data.value: Lists all active sessions on the server. If memory tracking is turned on, session size information is available.

data.name: activeSession1
data.value: View details of a selected active session and the largest variables in it.

data.name: activeSession2
data.value:
View the history of active sessions and logged in users over time. The logged in user count indicates the number of users logged in
using the CFLOGIN tag.

data.name: serverUsage0
data.value: Lists requests that have cumulatively consumed the most server time. Cumulative server time is computed as the average response time for a request multiplied by its hit count. Even if a request executes rapidly, it may consume a high proportion of server time due to a high hit count.

data.name: serverUsage1
data.value: View statistics for a request consuming high cumulative server time.

data.name: serverUsage2
data.value: View a pie chart that shows requests cumulatively consuming the most server time.

data.name: hitCounts0
data.value: Lists requests that have the highest hit count.

data.name: hitCounts1
data.value: View a summary of hits to the server by the different modes of access that ColdFusion provides, such as template requests from a browser, web service requests, gateway requests, remote CFC requests via HTTP, and Flash remoting requests.

data.name: tempCacheStat0
data.value: Provides information about the template cache. The cache hit ratio shows how well the cache is performing; a higher percentage indicates better performance because more templates are retrieved from the cache than from the file system. The graphs provide a historical view of cache behavior.

data.name: throttleStats0
data.value: Displays a list of requests that have been throttled by the server.

data.name: throttleStats1
data.value: View statistics for a selected throttled request.

data.name: throttleStats2
data.value: View historical data about how the total throttle memory and throttle size change over time.

data.name: memUtils0
data.value:
Displays a summary of estimated memory use across persistent scopes: the server scope, all application scopes and all session scopes.
Enable memory tracking to view this graph.

data.name: largeRequest0
data.value:
Lists the requests that have consumed the most memory during execution.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: largeRequest1
data.value: View statistics for a selected request. If profiling is turned on, the top 10 largest variables used over the execution of the request are also displayed.

data.name: memoryQueries0
data.value:
Lists the database queries that have used the most memory.
Enable memory tracking and profiling to view this report.

data.name: largeSession1
data.value:
View detailed information for a selected session.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: appScopeMem0
data.value:
Lists the sizes for all application scopes.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: appScopeMem1
data.value:
View detailed information for a selected application. For simple variables, displays the value. For complex ones, displays the type.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: serverScopeMem0
data.value:
Lists the 10 largest server scope variables. For simple variables, displays the value. For complex ones, displays the type.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: activeQueries0
data.value:
Lists all active database queries.
Enable profiling to view this report.

data.name: activeQueries1
data.value:
View information and statistics for the selected active query
Enable profiling to view this report.

data.name: slowQueries0
data.value:
Lists slowest database queries. Enable profiling to view this report.
Includes invocations of slow queries. Even if a query is not slow on average, it appears in the list if an invocation of the query was slower than the specified threshhold.

data.name: slowQueries1
data.value:
View information and statistics for the selected query
Enable profiling to view data in this report.

data.name: avgSlowQueries0
data.value:
Lists slowest database queries by average query execution time.
Enable profiling to view data in this report.

data.name: avgSlowQueries1
data.value: View information and statistics for the selected query. Enable profiling to view data in this report. You cannot view SQL for a query here because this report represents average information, and the SQL may vary from one invocation of a query to another.

data.name: cachedQueries0
data.value: Lists all queries in the query cache. Enable profiling and memory tracking to view accurate data. If you enable memory tracking after the query cache is populated, only size information is available for individual queries.

data.name: cachedQueries1
data.value: View information for a selected cached query. Enable profiling and memory tracking to view accurate data. If you enable memory tracking after the query cache has been populated, only size information is available.

data.name: queryCacheStatus0
data.value: Displays query cache information. A higher query cache hit ratio indicates better performance, because more queries are being retrieved from the cache than are executed on the database. Enable memory tracking and profiling to view the graphs.

data.name: dbPoolStats0
data.value: Lists information about all database pools.

data.name: dbPoolStats1
data.value: View configuration and statistics for a selected connection pool.

data.name: freqUsedQueries0
data.value: Lists the most frequently run queries.

data.name: freqUsedQueries1
data.value: View information and statistics for the selected query. Enable profiling to view data in this report. SQL for a query cannot be viewed here since this report represents average information, and the SQL may vary from one invocation of a query to another.

data.name: errorReq0
data.value: Lists all requests that have generated errors.

data.name: errorReq1
data.value: View details for the selected request, including both CFML and Java stack traces to indicate where the error occurred.

data.name: timeOutReq0
data.value: Lists all requests that have timed out.

data.name: timeOutReq1
data.value: View details for a selected request, including a CFML stack trace to indicate where the timeout occurred.

data.name: alertList0
data.value: View and manage the list of all snapshots generated by alerts. Click the View Snapshot icon next to an alert to view the associated snapshot file.

data.name: snapshot0
data.value:
View and manage user-generated snapshots. You can trigger a snapshot using the Trigger Snapshot button.
Click the View Snapshot icon next to a snapshot to view the associated snapshot file.

data.name: activeCFThread0
data.value: Lists all active ColdFusion threads on the server that are launched by the cfthread tag.

data.name: activeCFThread1
data.value: View details of an active ColdFusion thread on this page. The CFML stack trace provides a pointer to the state of the ColdFusion thread's execution.

data.name: activeCFThread2
data.value: View graphs detailing the running and queued ColdFusion thread count.

data.name: slowCFThread0
data.value: Lists the slowest ColdFusion threads on the server that are launched by the cfthread tag.

data.name: slowCFThread1
data.value:
View statistics for a selected slow ColdFusion thread. If profiling is turned on, the top 10 slowest tags and functions are also displayed, along with
a CFML stack trace to the location of the tag or function invocation.

data.name: largeCFThread0
data.value:
Lists ColdFusion threads that are consuming the most memory.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: largeCFThread1
data.value:
View detailed information for a selected ColdFusion thread.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.

data.name: alertLoginStr
data.value: Use the following information to log in to the mail server:

data.name: alertDescSetting
data.value: NOTE: The mail server is the one configured on the server Settings > Mail page of the ColdFusion Administrator.

data.name: confirmMsg
data.value: Are you sure you want to reset statistics on this page?

data.name: confirmMsg1
data.value: Are you sure you want to reset all the statistics?

data.name: addParamHint
data.value: ( Comma separated list of variables to monitor for Aliasing )

data.name: aliasing0
data.value: View and manage the list of all saved aliases. Click any row or button to edit saved settings.

data.name: profiling0
data.value: View and manage the list of all saved profiling settings.

data.name: emptyErrorMsg
data.value: None of Template Path, Alias Name, or Action Parameteres can be empty. Click OK to continue.

data.name: sameInputErrorMsg
data.value: Both Template Path and Alias Name should be unique and not empty for each setting. Click OK to continue.

data.name: excludeProfileMsg
data.value: Any path you specify below will not be profiled by the Server Monitor.

data.name: includeProfileMsg
data.value: Any path you specify below will be profiled by the Server Monitor.

data.name: remoteInstanceMonitor_PageNotes
data.value: You can monitor remote ColdFusion installations using this panel. You must put crossdomain.xml on each server you monitor with permissions to connect from this machine.

data.name: connectedToolTip
data.value: Connected to server which served this ServerMonitor.

data.name: disConnectedToolTip
data.value: Unable to connect to server which served this ServerMonitor.

data.name: cfc_desc1
data.value: Note: Alert CFCs must have two functions, onAlertStart() and onAlertEnd(), which accept a structure as an argument and return no values.

data.name: cfc_desc3
data.value: This function is executed when an alert becomes active.

data.name: cfc_desc4
data.value: The structure passed to this function contains information about settings at which the alert was activated.

data.name: cfc_desc6
data.value: This function is executed when the server recovers from this alert or this alert is invalidated.

data.name: cfc_desc7
data.value: The structure passed to this function contains the alert settings when the alert was recovered or disabled.

data.name: cfc_desc8
data.value: The structure also contains information regarding actions taken by the Server Monitor to recover from the alert state.

data.name: cfc_desc9
data.value: for example, the threads killed or name of the snapshot that is dumped, and so on.

data.name: hungServerDesc_1
data.value: If the number of threads specified by Hung Thread Count execute for longer than the time specified by Busy Thread Time,

data.name: hungServerDesc_2
data.value: the server is considered to be unresponsive.

data.name: slowServerDesc_1
data.value: If the average response time of the server is greater than than the threshold specified below, a Slow Server alert is created.

data.name: jvmDesc_1
data.value: If used JVM memory on the server is greater than the threshold specified below, a JVM Memory alert is created.

data.name: timeoutsDesc_1
data.value: If the number of requests specified by Timeouts Count time out within the time interval specified by Time Interval, a timeouts alert is created.

data.name: avgSlowRequest0
data.value:
Lists the slowest requests to the server by average response time.
If the request is for a CFC, the requested CFC function name also appears.

data.name: avgSlowRequest1
data.value:
View statistics for a selected slow request. If profiling is turned on, the top 10 slowest tags and functions are also displayed, along with
a CFML stack trace to the location of the tag or function invocation.

data.name: confirmDelAllSnapshot
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete all the snapshots?

data.name: loginErrMsg
data.value: Login failed. Please try logging in again.

data.name: pathtoCFIDE
data.value: Path to CFIDE directory on server :

data.name: refreshUIStr
data.value: Server Monitor has been stopped. Server Monitor will auto refresh now.

data.name: tryingToConnect
data.value: Trying to connect and log in ...

data.name: logoutErrMsg
data.value: You are logged out from the ColdFusion Server.

data.name: liststatsofcacheRegions
data.value: Lists the statistics of the cache regions

data.name: viewingStatsApp
data.value: You are viewing the statistics of

data.name: memoryQueries1
data.value: View statistics for a selected database query. SQL for a query cannot be viewed here since this report represents average information, and the SQL may vary from one invocation of a query to another.

data.name: largeSession0
data.value:
Lists the active sessions that are consuming the most memory.
Enable memory tracking to view this report.
